note.p: Death: Ramsgate, Kent, England, United Kingdom (30 November 1846)
Profession: Merchant; lawyer; collector; plantation and slave owner

Career: Partner, Manning & Anderdon the family mercantile firm (1794-1816); retired 1816. Manning & Anderdon owned sugar estates in the Caribbean which used enslaved people for labour; after retirement became an art collector and ammassed a significant collection which was sold by Christies in 1847 and 1851; Deputy Liutenant, Hampshire (1820)
Sources: Bulloch's Roll; UCL LBS; 'Landed Families of Britain and Ireland'
References: The Literary panorama, Volume 11, Issue 1812
'John Proctor Anderdon', Legacies of British Slave-ownership database, http://wwwdepts-live.ucl.ac.uk/lbs/person/view/926 [accessed 23rd June 2020].
